alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 12:40PM CST until January 17 at 10:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM TUESDAY TO 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain possible. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze. Very cold wind chills in the single digits and lower teens expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 9 AM CST Tuesday. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM Tuesday to 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Sidewalks and roads, particularly bridges, overpasses, and lesser traveled secondary roads, may become slippery. The hazardous conditions could impact the commute tonight and Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will start out as rain this afternoon and evening, but as temperatures quickly fall tonight, there will be a brief chance for freezing rain before precipitation ends late tonight and early Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock
